qas.question: Comcast joined with what media company to acquire a movie studio in 2005?
What movie studios did Comcast and their partner buy?

answers.text: MGM and its affiliate studio, United Artists

qas.question: What Pennsylvania cable provider did Comcast buy controlling interest in during 2005?
When did Comcast formally announce its purchase of this cable provider?
How much did Comcast pay for this cable tv provider?
What did Comcast and MGM buy in 2005?
How much did Comcast purchase MGM for?
How much of Lenfest did Comcast own?
How many internet customers did the partnership with Sony Pictures garner Comcast?

context: On April 8, 2005, a partnership led by Comcast and <a0_0><b5_0>Sony Pictures Entertainment<b5_0/><a0_0/> finalized a deal to acquire <a1_0>MGM and its affiliate studio, United Artists<a1_0/>, and create an additional outlet to carry MGM/UA's material for cable and Internet distribution. On <a3_0>October 31, 2005<a3_0/>, Comcast officially announced that it had acquired <a2_0>Susquehanna Communications<a2_0/> a <b6_0>South Central Pennsylvania<b6_0/>, -based cable television and broadband services provider and unit of the former Susquehanna Pfaltzgraff company, for <a4_0><b7_0>$775 million<b7_0/> cash<a4_0/>. In this deal Comcast acquired approximately 230,000 basic cable customers, 71,000 digital cable customers, and <b9_0>86,000<b9_0/> high-speed Internet customers. Comcast previously owned approximately <b8_0>30 percent<b8_0/> of Susquehanna Communications through affiliate company Lenfest. In December 2005, Comcast announced the creation of Comcast Interactive Media, a new division focused on online media.
